Name: Name
The name of the Tomcat cluster service: The name of the Tomcat cluster service
The description of the Tomcat cluster se: The description of the Tomcat cluster service
Choose a loadbalancer service (When you: Choose a loadbalancer service (When you create loadbalancer, you need to select the Internet type. Loadbalancer listener need to enable Session Sticky. Listener protocol should be http)
Number of nodes for the cluster to creat: Number of nodes for the cluster to create
The instance type for the cluster to run: The instance type for the cluster to run, such as high performance, high performance plus
The volume size for each node: The volume size for each node
Password of Tomcat user, the default pas: Password of Tomcat user, the default password is 'qing0pwd'
Tomcat character encoding, this value wi: Tomcat character encoding, this value will be set in javax.servlet.request.encoding and file.encoding when launching Tomcat, also set in URIEncoding in server.xml
The max number of active threads: The max number of active threads
The max number of active threads in Tomc: The max number of active threads in Tomcat shared thread pool
The minimum number of kept alive threads: The minimum number of kept alive threads
The minimum number of threads always kep: The minimum number of threads always kept alive in Tomcat shared thread pool
The number of milliseconds before an idl: The number of milliseconds before an idle thread shutsdown
The number of milliseconds before an idle thread shutsdown, unless the number of active threads are less or equal to minSpareThreads
Java runtime properties when running Tom: Java runtime properties when running Tomcat, leave empty if you accept our default JVM heap size setting(1/4 memory as xms, and 1/2 memory as xmx). Note: our default setting will not take effect if you input any value in this area, the validaton of JAVA_OPTS should be handled by you ahead of time, otherwise Tomcat server may fail to start
Choose a way to upload WAR to Tomcat ser: Choose a way to upload WAR to Tomcat server, the default way is using Tomcat manager UI or command, the other option is QingStor. Note: Tomcat manager could only deploy WAR to single node, we monitor that deployment and copy the deployed WAR file to watched folder of Tomcat FarmWarDeployer, which will distribute this file to other nodes
Whether to use Redis database to replica: Whether to use Redis database to replicate session data
The IP address of Redis database: The IP address of Redis database
The IP address of Redis database, leave: The IP address of Redis database, leave empty if you choose not to use Redis database
The port of Redis database, leave empty: The port of Redis database, leave empty if you choose not to use Redis database
Redis Database Number, leave empty if yo: Redis Database Number, leave empty if you choose not to use Redis database
access_key_id to access QingStor service: access_key_id to access QingStor service for web application(WAR) deployment, leave empty if you chooose to use Tomcat Manager or Jenkins
secret_access_key to access QingStor ser: secret_access_key to access QingStor service for web application(WAR) deployment, leave empty if you chooose to use Tomcat Manager or Jenkins
Zone of bucket for web application(WAR): Zone of bucket for web application(WAR) deployment, leave empty if you chooose to use Tomcat Manager or Jenkins
Bucket name for web application(WAR) dep: Bucket name for web application(WAR) deployment, leave empty if you chooose to use Tomcat Manager or Jenkins
The web application(WAR) file Name, leav: The web application(WAR) file Name, leave empty if you chooose to use Tomcat Manager or Jenkins
Whether to use MySql database for develo: Whether to use MySql database for development
User name of MySql database, leave empty: User name of MySql database, leave empty if you choose not to use MySql database
Password of MySql database, leave empty: Password of MySql database, leave empty if you choose not to use MySql database
The IP address of MySql database: The IP address of MySql database
The IP address of MySql database, leave: The IP address of MySql database, leave empty if you choose not to use MySql database
The port of MySql database, leave empty: The port of MySql database, leave empty if you choose not to use MySql database
MySql Database Name, leave empty if you: MySql Database Name, leave empty if you choose not to use MySql database
Datasoure name of Tomcat JDBC connection: Datasoure name of Tomcat JDBC connection pool
Datasoure name of Tomcat JDBC connection pool to connect MySql database
The maximum number of active database co: The maximum number of active database connections
The maximum number of active database connections that can be allocated from this pool at the same time
The maximum number of kept database conn: The maximum number of kept database connections
The maximum number of database connectio: The maximum number of database connections that should be kept in the pool at all times
The maximum number of milliseconds befor: The maximum number of milliseconds before a database connection timeout
The maximum number of milliseconds that: The maximum number of milliseconds that the pool will wait (when there are no available connections) for a database connection to be returned before throwing an exception
ajp_currentThreadCount: Current thread count of AJP connector
ajp_currentThreadsBusy: Current busy thread count of AJP connector
ajp_maxTime: The max request processing time of AJP connector, the unit is millisecond
http_currentThreadCount: Current thread count of http connector
http_currentThreadsBusy: Current busy thread count of http connector
http_maxTime: The max request processing time of http connector, the unit is millisecond
maxTime: The max request processing time, the unit is millisecond
